title: Do you mix egg in to your ground beef to make hamburgers? - Quora

response.answer_text: Absolutely no need, don’t believe the rubbish. I’m a chef, and there is zero need to do that. All you need is: Good quality minced beef and one that still has some fat in it — never go for the ones with all the fat taken out, then a good frying pan, i use rapeseed oil as it can withstand higher temperatures than olive oil, and then some salt and ground black pepper. Just get a bowl and mix all of that together, then shape it into a patty and do it for as long as you like — i like mine medium rare so for me its about 4 minutes each side. Do not make them too thick. Good luck.

I don’t. I just use good beef with at least 15–20% fat (or so I’m lead to believe), and don’t overcook- anything more than medium will be too dry in my opinion. I do like the egg addition method, and also sometimes with bread crumb and Worcestershire sauce method, I just don’t bother. It’s a nice change of pace though. They are more like small meatloaves rather than burgers. Bon Appetit
